title: C++ Level 3 — Conditional Statements
concept: Use if-else to classify numbers and handle simple logic.

challenges.title: Positive, Negative or Zero
challenges.description: Given an integer n, print Positive if n > 0, Negative if n < 0, or Zero if n == 0.
challenges.outputDescription: One word: Positive, Negative, or Zero.

challenges.title: Max of Three Numbers
challenges.description: Given three integers a, b, c, print the largest of them.

challenges.title: Minimum of Three Numbers
challenges.description: Given three integers a, b, c, print the smallest of them.

challenges.title: How Many Are Equal
challenges.description: Given three integers a, b, c, print 3 if all are equal, 2 if exactly two are equal, or 0 if all are different.

challenges.title: Leap Year Check
challenges.description: Given a year y, print LEAP if it's a leap year in Gregorian calendar and COMMON otherwise.

challenges.title: Chess Rook Move
challenges.description: Given coordinates of two squares (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) on a chessboard, print YES if a rook can move from the first to the second in one move, otherwise NO.
challenges.inputDescription: Four integers x1, y1, x2, y2 (1–8).

challenges.title: Same Color Cells
challenges.description: Given two cells (x1,y1) and (x2,y2), print YES if they are the same color on a chessboard, else NO.
challenges.inputDescription: Four integers x1, y1, x2, y2.

challenges.title: Chess King Move
challenges.description: Given two cells, print YES if a king can go from first to second in one move, else NO.
challenges.inputDescription: Four integers x1, y1, x2, y2.

challenges.title: Chocolate Bar Split
challenges.description: A chocolate bar of size n×m can be broken along grid lines. Print YES if it is possible to break off exactly k squares in one break, else NO.

challenges.title: Chess Knight Move
challenges.description: Given two cells, print YES if a knight can move from first to second in one move, else NO.
challenges.inputDescription: Four integers x1, y1, x2, y2.
